channel.title: Posts on Mostly Harmless Cafe
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Mostly Harmless Cafe

item.title: Aperol Spritz
item.description: Ingredients ice 3 oz. prosecco 3 oz. aperol subst: select 1 oz. club soda 2 olives (garnish) Instructions Add everything in glass, stir to combine. Optional Serve before lunch

item.title: Lasagna
item.description: Ingredients 9 lasagna noodles 1 lb ground beef ½ lb ground pork subst: ¼ lb sausage 8 oz mushrooms (sliced) 1 small onion (diced) 1 tsp fennel seeds (ground) 6 oz can of tomato paste 28 oz can of crushed tomatoes 2 cloves of garlic (minced) 2 inch knob of ginger (minced) 15 oz ricotta 1 egg ¼ cup pecorino romano 8 oz mozzarella cheese not pre-shredded, cheaper is better, feel free to add more salt & pepper vegetable oil (for cooking meat) olive oil (for cooking sauce) Instructions Preheat oven to 375F Cook noodles per box instructions (don’t forget to salt water).

item.title: Blue Cheese Burger
item.description: Ingredients: 1 lb ground beef (20%+ fat) hamburger buns jalapeno (sliced, ⅛ inch) yellow onion (sliced as thin as you can) ⅓ cup of blue cheese crumbles if you’re using a solid block, cut off enough to stack on a burger about ¼ inch high blackened seasoning buffalo sauce of choice salt & pepper Instructions: On medium heat, toast the inner side of the buns with olive oil. About 2½-3 minutes is usually enough.

item.title: Curry Aioli
item.description: Ingredients: 2 Tbsp mayonnaise 1 clove of garlic (grated) 1 tsp lemon juice ½ tsp curry powder ¼ tsp salt ¼ tsp pepper Instructions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix.

item.title: Dead's Fried Rice
item.description: Ingredients (chicken): 1 chicken thigh 1 tbsp shaoxing wine subst: 1 tbsp chicken stock and 1 tsp of lemon juice 1 tbsp soy sauce 1 tbsp gochujang 1 tsp ground ginger 1 tsp garlic powder 1 tsp salt Recommended marinade time, 45 min or overnight (optimal) Ingredients (rice): 1 cup rice (uncooked) chicken stock subst: water ½ onion (diced) 2 inch knob of ginger (minced) 2 eggs (scrambled) 1 tbsp soy sauce 1 clove of garlic (grated) 1 tbsp sambal oelek 1 green onion (thinly sliced) Instructions (chicken): Carve chicken thigh (if necessary), removing bone and skin, and cut into bite size pieces.

item.title: Garlic Tomato Pasta
item.description: Ingredients (pasta): 120g pasta (spaghetti, dry) Ingredients (sauce): ¼ cup extra virgin olive oil 3 cloves of garlic 1 anchovy 12 cherry tomatoes (halved) 1 tsp red pepper flakes ½ tsp pepper ½ tsp salt 1 Tbsp lemon juice shredded Pecorino Romano The Pecorino will be garnish so just grate however much you think you’ll need. You can also add in some chicken. If you do, marinade it with garlic powder, ground ginger, lemon juice, and salt for around 30-45 minutes, cook, and set aside for later.

item.title: General Dead's Chicken
item.description: Ingredients (chicken): 2 chicken thighs 2 tbsp shaoxing wine (subst.: 1 tbsp soy sauce) 1 tbsp soy sauce 2 cloves of garlic (grated) 1 inch knob of ginger (grated) pinch of salt Recommended marinade time: 45 min or overnight (optimal) Ingredients (dredge): 2 cups of flour 1 cup of corn starch 2 eggs (whites) Ingredients (sauce): 1 tbsp shaoxing wine subst: chinkiang vinegar ½ cup chicken stock 3 tbsp soy sauce 1 tbsp mirin optional subst: rice vinegar 3 tbsp sugar 1 tsp msg 3 cloves of garlic (minced) 3 inch knob of ginger (minced) 1 habanero pepper (diced) 1 tbsp cornstarch 1 ½ tbsp vinegar Instructions: Put egg whites in bowl, whisk.

item.title: General Tsos Chicken
item.description: Ingredients (chicken): 2 chicken thighs 2 Tbsp Shaoxing Wine 1 Tbsp soy sauce 2 cloves of garlic (grated) 1 inch knob of ginger (grated) pinch of salt Recommended marinade time, 45 min or overnight (optimal) Ingredients (sauce): 1 Tbsp Shaoxing Wine ½ cup chicken stock 3 Tbsp soy sauce 3 Tbsp sugar 4 cloves of garlic (minced) 2 inch knob of ginger (minced) 1 tsp chili flakes 5 dried chili peppers 1 Tbsp cornstarch 1 ½ Tbsp vinegar Instructions: Dredge chicken in a 1:1 mix of cornstarch and flour.

item.title: Hot Chocolate
item.description: Ingredients: 1 ½ cups whole milk 4 oz finely chopped cocoa (usally one square, 100% cocoa) 1 ½ Tbsp sugar 1 Tbsp cocoa powder 1 Tbsp cornstarch Instructions: Put chopped cocoa and a splash of milk into pot on med heat, heat until cocoa has melted. Add sugar and cocoa powder. In separate bowl, mix cornstarch with splash of milk (making a slurry). Stream in slurry, mix until consistent and thickened.

item.title: Irish Car Bomb
item.description: Ingredients: 1 pint Irish stout (personal: Guiness) ½ oz Irish cream ¼ oz coffee liqeur ¼ oz Irish whiskey (personal: Jameson)

item.title: Jalapeno Cheddar Burger
item.description: Ingredients (beef): I know that American Cheese isn’t very popular with a lot of people but it melts better than most other cheeses so it’s good for putting on top of other ingredients. ½ pound ground beef 1 slice of cheddar cheese 1 slice of american cheese (subst. whatever cheese you want) 1 jalapeno (sliced to desired thickness) Ingredients (sauce): This is about enough sauce for 10 burgers so put the difference in a box or something.

item.title: Japanese Wafu Pasta
item.description: Ingredients 1 lb spaghetti ¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil 8 Tbsp unsalted butter 4 cloves of garlic ¼ tsp salt 15 cranks of fresh cracked black pepper 1 lb shiitake mushrooms ¼ cup soy sauce 2 scallions (garnish) Instructions: Boil pasta for recommended time, set aside when done, reserving at least ½ cup of pasta water. In skillet on medium heat add olive oil with 4 Tbsp of butter. Once butter melts, add garlic and mushrooms.

item.title: Pancakes
item.description: Ingredients: 1 ½ cups milk 1 egg ¼ cup sugar 1 tsp salt ¼ tsp baking soda 1 Tbsp baking powder 2 Tbsp melted butter Instructions: Pour onto medium heat pan. Flip when bubbles appear on top

item.title: Penne Alla Vodka
item.description: Ingredients: 1 lb penne pasta ½ Tbsp extra virgin olive oil 100 g pancetta (can use bacon) 1 shallot (minced) 3 cups (2 cans) crushed tomatoes ⅓ cup heavy cream ⅓ cup vodka Instructions: Go ahead and make the pasta before starting the sauce and reserve ¼ cup of the resulting pasta water. Add olive oil to pan on medium heat. Add pancetta/bacon, let simmer until all the grease has been sweated out.

item.title: Phisch's BBQ Sauce
item.description: Ingredients: 1 cup ketchup 1 shallot (finely diced) subst: red onions 1 clove garlic (finely diced) 1 inch ginger (finely diced) 1 tbsp sunflower oil 1 tsp chili flakes 1½ tbsp. brown sugar 3 tsp smoked paprika 1½ tbsp. apple cider vinegar subst: red wine vinegar 1 tsp worchestorshire sauce 2 tbsp dark soy sauce black pepper salt Instructions: Add shallots, garlic, ginger, sunflower oil, and chili flakes to pan on medium heat.

item.title: Spaghetti and Meatballs
item.description: Ingredients (meatballs) ¼ lb ham (minced) 1 lb ground beef 1 tsp ground fennel seeds 1 ¾ tsp sea salt 3 cloves garlic ¼ cup Pecorino Romano (fine shredded) blackpepper (from the hip) ½ cup panko 1 whole egg Ingredients (sauce): ¼ cup extra virgin olive oil 4 cloves garlic (thinly sliced) 1 tsp red pepper flakes t tsp salt 1 can (28 oz.) crushed tomatoes 1 bunch of basil You can use 2 cans of crushed tomatoes if you like a lot of sauce.

item.title: White Wine Sauce
item.description: Ingredients (pasta, chicken, and tomatoes): 1 lb pasta 300 g chicken thighs (cut into bite-size pieces) 1 package of cherry tomatoes (halved) ½ tsp salt ¼ tsp pepper Ingredients (sauce): 3 cloves of garlic (minced) ¼ cup extra virgin olive oil 5 Tbsp butter (unsalted) ½ tsp crushed red pepper 1 tsp salt ½ tsp ground black pepper ½ cup white wine (your choice thereof) Instructions (chicken and tomatoes): If you’re having this with pasta, go ahead and cook that, chill with water, and set to the side.

item.title: Beef Stroganoff
item.description: Ingredients: 1 lb wide egg noodles (dry) ¼ cup butter (divide into 2) 1½ lbs thin sliced chuck (~¼inch) salt & pepper 1 yellow onion (sliced) 1 lb bella mushrooms (sliced) 4 cloves garlic (minced) ½ cup white wine subst: ½ cup vegetable stock and 1 tbsp white vinegar 2 cups beef stock 1 tbsp worcestershire sauce 3½ tbsp all-purpose flour ½ cup sour cream opt: set aside additional for topping Instructions: Cover meat in salt and pepper.

item.title: Buffalo Chicken Dip
item.description: Ingredients: 2 cups shredded chicken 8 oz cream cheese (softened) ½ cup Frank’s Red Hot ½ cup ranch 1 block (roughly 6 oz) cheddar cheese (freshly grated) ½ cup blue cheese crumbles Instructions (chicken): Bring water to simmer. Place chicken in water, cover with lid, and leave for 45 minutes. Remove chicken, carve the meat, and shred using whatever works. Instructions (dip): Mix together cream cheese, hot sauce, and ranch. Mix in chicken.

item.title: Chicken Adobo
item.description: Ingredients (chicken): 4 lbs chicken Bone in, with skin. Can be pretty much any part of the chicken. It’s nice to have diversity but if only given one choice, chicken thighs work best. Ingredients (sauce): 20 cloves of garlic (minced) 1 Tbsp black peppercorns crack of fresh ground black pepper 3 Tbsp palm sugar (can use brown sugar) 1 ¼ cup rice vinegar ½ cup soy sauce ¼ cup dark soy sauce ½ cup water Instructions: Marinade chicken for two hours.

item.title: Chicken Marinade
item.description: Ingredients: 1 Cup Soy sauce ¼ Cup Worchestorshire sauce ¼ Cup Brown Sugar 3 cloves of garlic (minced) Instructions: Throw all the chicken in a ziplock bag with the marinade, store in fridge, and use as needed.

item.title: Chow Mein
item.description: Ingredients (noodles): 400g egg noodles 2 chicken breasts (scored and chopped into bite-sized pieces) feel free to marinade 2 green onions (segmented) 1 carror (julienne) 3½ cups cabbage (about half of one head) 7 cloves of garlic (minced) 1 cup bean sprouts 2 Tbsp water Ingredients (sauce): 1½ Tbsp rice vinegar 2½ Tbsp soy sauce 2 Tbsp oyster sauce subst: hoisin sauce 3 tsp sesame oil 2 tsp cornstarch Instructions: Cook chicken to completion in wok, remove, and set to the side.

item.title: Pepperoncini Roast
item.description: Ingredients: 3½-4 lbs chuck roast 1 jar pepperoncinis (capped, kepp juice) 1 8 oz. can tomato sauce (keep jar for water) 1 oz. packet ranch seasoning 1 oz. packet au jus 1 oz. packet beef stew seasoning 4 carrots (split and segmented) 1 yellow onion (diced) Instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Season roast generously with salt and pepper on all sides. Let sit for 6 minutes. Put oil in dutch oven on med-high, sear roast, approx.
